page.title: 02A Hamilton Farmer's Day
page.content: Mr Kirk has a mixed-farm - he keeps dairy cattle and grows crops. Monday started at 5.30 am when he got up. At 5.55 it was time to bring the cows into the milking shed to start milking at 6.00. He had his breakfast at 8.00. At 8.30 he had to fetch 14 heifers from the field and put 22 young calves outside. At 9.30 the{Milk Tanker} arrived to collect the morning's milk. He had plenty of paper-work to do - VAT and general book-keeping. He had a break at 10.30 after which it was time to clean out the calf-pen. At 12.00 the{AI (Artificial Insemination)}man arrived. At 12.30 pm it was time for dinner. At 1.30 some more calves had to be moved outside. Spring cleaning had to be done at 2.30. At 3.30 it was tea-break, and at 3.45 milking-time. Tea-time was 5.30, and at 6.30 there was time for odd-jobs.
